alert.note: Alert for Marion (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 2:28PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marion County through 300 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ramona, or 10 miles southwest of Herington, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincolnville, Ramona, Durham, Tampa, Lost Springs, Pilsen and Marion Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for central and east central Kansas.
